intro: Triodia inaequiloba, commonly known as the narrow-leaved spinifex, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the grass family (Poaceae) and is characterized by its dense, wiry growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that bear tiny, pale blue or white flowers. It is well adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in sandy or gravelly soils. Triodia inaequiloba plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for small fauna in its native range.
